thread.title: Warriors-Spurs clash Saturday night in battle of no stars on ABC
thread.title_full: Warriors-Spurs clash Saturday night in battle of no stars on ABC

author: Dan Sostek (daniel.sostek@performgroup.com)
title: Warriors-Spurs clash Saturday night in battle of no stars on ABC

organizations.name: patty mills sg- danny green sf

text:
March 11, 2017 7:47pm EST March 11, 2017 7:47pm EST Follow along for live coverage of the Spurs-Warriors matchup. The Spurs controlled the pace of the game against the Warriors. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:47 p.m. ET 
Updated at 7:47 p.m. ET 
It's Saturday night and the two best teams in the NBA are going at it. 
Well, sort of. 
MORE: Spurs' Kawhi Leonard is crashing the James Harden-Russell Westbrook MVP party 
The Warriors travel to San Antonio to take on the Spurs, but there won't be too many familiar faces on either side of the ball. For the Warriors, Steph Curry, Klay Thompson, Draymond Green, Andre Iguodala and Kevin Durant are all out, while Gregg Poppovich and San Antonio will be without Kawhi Leonard, LaMarcus Aldridge, Tony Parker and Pau Gasol. 
Well, if a Patty Mills-Shaun Livingston battle still piques your interest, Sporting News will be hosting a live blog for this No-Star game right here. What time is the game? 
The game starts at 8:30 p.m. What channel is the game on? 
The game will air on ABC. What are the Warriors' and Spurs' records? 
The Warriors are 52-13, and the Spurs are 50-14. San Antonio is 1.5 games behind Golden State for first place in the West. What are the starting lineups? 
Warriors: PG- Shaun Livingston SG- Patrick McCaw SF- Matt Barnes PF- Kevon Looney C- Zaza Pachulia 
Spurs: PG- Patty Mills SG- Danny Green SF- Kyle Anderson PF- David Lee C- Dewayne Dedmon
